title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement wpetry@ncsu.edu. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: William K. Petry. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Petry, W.K. (2023). “readr: Tools Interacting Survey Points Collected Emlid GNSS Products.” https://github.com/DICELab-NCSU/reachr.
code: @Misc{,   title = {readr: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products},   author = {{Petry} and {W.K.}},   year = {2023},   url = {https://github.com/DICELab-NCSU/reachr}, }

what: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
title: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
text: goal reachr provide utilities working data produced Emlid products, including Reach RS2(+) GNSS receiver Emlid Studio post-processing software.

title: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
text: package still ‘experimental’ stage yet submitted CRAN. can install development version reachr GitHub : package can loaded :

title: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
text: read_emlid function provides wrapper import various file formats spatial data used Emlid, returning sf object. function guessed file format based file extension. Emlid file exports include coordinate reference system (CRS). read_emlid warns users file imported without known CRS allows users specify CRS import using standard formats: EPSG codes, WKT, proj4string.
code: mypoints <- read_emlid("path/to/data/mypoints.shp") mypoints2 <- read_emlid("path/to/data/mypoints2.csv")  # imports with warning mypoints2 <- read_emlid("path/to/data/mypoints2.csv", crs = 4326)  # sets CRS

what: Update RTK coordinate to new base position
title: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
text: RTK surveys, possible obtain precise coordinate base position prior collecting points rover. still possible collect points using RTK relative estimated base position, update points use correct base position (e.g., PPP post-processing). reachr automates process shifting coordinates rover-collected points use updated base position following tutorial post Emlid Community Forum.

title: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
text: ef_geom_check: checks point geometries used spatial data object, ensuring can imported Emlid Flow as_ef_geom: attempts automatically coerce non-point geometries (multi)point geometries can imported Emlid Flow check_rtk_range: checks points within LoRa antenna range RTK surveying llh_summary: summarizes position duration .LLH log files

what: Prepare .csv file for Emlid Flow import
title: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
text: Importing points .csv file Emlid Flow project requires following strict column order naming convention. (July 2023, incompletely documented import dialog.) reachr provides helper functions convert sf objects correctly-formatted .csv file.

title: Tools for Interacting with Survey Points Collected by Emlid GNSS Products
text: Please note reachr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Convert sf geometries to points compatible with Emlid Flow import. — as_ef_geom
title: Convert sf geometries to points compatible with Emlid Flow import. — as_ef_geom
text: Convert sf geometries points compatible Emlid Flow import.

title: Convert sf geometries to points compatible with Emlid Flow import. — as_ef_geom
Convert sf geometries to points compatible with Emlid Flow import. — as_ef_geom
text: x sf object.

title: Convert sf geometries to points compatible with Emlid Flow import. — as_ef_geom
text: sf object type POINT MULTIPOINT.

title: Convert sf geometries to points compatible with Emlid Flow import. — as_ef_geom
text: wrapper sf::st_cast() tries convert original geometry suitable (multi)point representation.

title: Convert sf geometries to points compatible with Emlid Flow import. — as_ef_geom
code: outer <- matrix(c(0, 0, 10, 0, 10, 10, 0, 10, 0, 0), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) hole1 <- matrix(c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) hole2 <- matrix(c(5, 5, 5, 6, 6, 6, 6, 5, 5, 5), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) poly <- sf::st_polygon(list(outer, hole1, hole2)) as_ef_geom(poly)  # returns nodes of outer, omitting holes #> MULTIPOINT ((0 0), (10 0), (10 10), (0 10))

what: Check if sf geometry is suitable for importing into Emlid Flow — check_ef_geom
title: Check if sf geometry is suitable for importing into Emlid Flow — check_ef_geom
text: Check sf geometry suitable importing Emlid Flow

title: Check if sf geometry is suitable for importing into Emlid Flow — check_ef_geom
Check if sf geometry is suitable for importing into Emlid Flow — check_ef_geom
text: x sf object.

title: Check if sf geometry is suitable for importing into Emlid Flow — check_ef_geom
text: logical. TRUE indicates current geometry type compatible import.

title: Check if sf geometry is suitable for importing into Emlid Flow — check_ef_geom
text: Emlid Flow currently supports (multi)point geometries.

what: Check that points or area of interest are within range of proposed RTK base. — check_rtk_range
title: Check that points or area of interest are within range of proposed RTK base. — check_rtk_range
text: Check points area interest within range proposed RTK base.

title: Check that points or area of interest are within range of proposed RTK base. — check_rtk_range
code: check_rtk_range(   rover,   base,   local_crs = getOption("local_crs"),   range = getOption("lora_range", 8000),   plot = TRUE )

title: Check that points or area of interest are within range of proposed RTK base. — check_rtk_range
text: rover sf object. Point(s) polygon(s) containing area interest rover used. base sf object. point containing proposed coordinates RTK base. local_crs String. projected coordinate reference system, either EPSG code, WKT, proj4string. range Numeric. nominal range LoRa signal meters, defaults 8000 m (=8 km). plot Logical. Whether

title: Check that points or area of interest are within range of proposed RTK base. — check_rtk_range
text: Logical, also message reporting result (optionally) ggplot.

title: Download Emlid Flow360 projects — dnld_flow360
text: Download Emlid Flow360 projects

title: Download Emlid Flow360 projects — dnld_flow360
code: dnld_flow360(   dir = "~/Downloads",   overwrite = FALSE,   usr = Sys.getenv("EMLID_USER"),   pwd = Sys.getenv("EMLID_PASSWORD"),   mult = 1,   scroll_step = 250,   max_scrolls = 100 )

title: Download Emlid Flow360 projects — dnld_flow360
text: dir Directory downloaded csv files saved. overwrite Logical, whether overwrite existing files name. YET IMPLEMENTED. usr Emlid credential username. pwd Emlid credential password. mult Multiplier default wait times. scroll_step Pixel distance move scrolling . max_scrolls Maximum number scroll movements attempt.

title: Download Emlid Flow360 projects — dnld_flow360
text: (Invisible) Files downloaded specified directory.

what: Summarize LLH log file to aid download of CORS/VRS corrections — llh_summary
title: Summarize LLH log file to aid download of CORS/VRS corrections — llh_summary
text: Summarize LLH log file aid download CORS/VRS corrections

title: Summarize LLH log file to aid download of CORS/VRS corrections — llh_summary
Summarize LLH log file to aid download of CORS/VRS corrections — llh_summary
text: llh File path .LLH log file rnd Number minutes round ends logging duration (see Details) ... Additional arguments passed utils::read.table()

title: Summarize LLH log file to aid download of CORS/VRS corrections — llh_summary
text: list containing average logged position position statistics.

title: Summarize LLH log file to aid download of CORS/VRS corrections — llh_summary
text: 'rnd' argument helps pad logging interval ensure VRS data include entire logging duration. value 0 pad either start end times, resulting exact start time duration LLH log. Positive values ceiling round start time floor round stop time number minutes specified user. example, interval 10:28:53-13:56:23 round follows: rnd = 0: 10:28:53-13:56:23, duration 03:28:30 rnd = 1: 10:28:00-13:57:00, duration 03:29:00 rnd = 15: 10:15:00-14:00:00, duration 04:15:00 additional information rounding behaviors, see ?lubridate::round_date.

title: Summarize LLH log file to aid download of CORS/VRS corrections — llh_summary

what: Determine target point coordinates from distances to known points — multilaterate
title: Determine target point coordinates from distances to known points — multilaterate
text: Determine target point coordinates distances known points

title: Determine target point coordinates from distances to known points — multilaterate
code: multilaterate(distances, ref_points, crs = NULL, plot = TRUE)

title: Determine target point coordinates from distances to known points — multilaterate
text: distances named vector containing distances least 3 ref_points target point. ref_points sf object containing reference point geometry 'Name' column. crs projected coordinate reference system use distance calculations ref_points already projected CRS. plot Logical, whether plot multilateration solution.

title: Determine target point coordinates from distances to known points — multilaterate
text: list, xy coordinates coords, measures coordinate positional uncertainty se, mean ellipsoidal height reference points mean_ellipsoid_height.

title: Determine target point coordinates from distances to known points — multilaterate
text: function performs 2D multilateration via optimization. optimization fail give nonsensical results units distances crs identical. recommended use meters. standard errors x coordinate, y coordinate, xy positional uncertainty calculated Hessian objective function.

title: Determine target point coordinates from distances to known points — multilaterate
code: d <- c(A = 7.1, B = 7.2, C = 7.0, D = 7.1) ref <- sf::st_as_sf(data.frame(  Name = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),  x = c(0, 10, 0, 10),   y = c(0, 0, 10, 10) ), coords = c("x", "y"), crs = 32613) multilaterate(distances = d, ref_points = ref)  #> Warning: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA #> $coords #>        x        y  #> 4.929006 5.070994  #>  #> $se #>       se_x       se_y      se_xy  #> 0.02024968 0.02024968 0.02863737  #>  #> $mean_ellipsoid_height #> [1] NA #>

title: reachr 0.1
text: Added check_rtk_range utility function test whether base position suitable rover use location area interest. Added basic geometry tools checking converting Emlid Flow compatible geometries.
